meanings.definition: The doctrine or practice of baptizing someone again.
meanings.sent1: Anabaptism is when a person gets baptized more than once.
meanings.sent2: In some churches, anabaptism is the act of re-baptizing individuals.
meanings.sent3: The debate over anabaptism led to some comical misunderstandings in the community.
meanings.sent4: Her belief in anabaptism was like hitting the reset button on her faith.
meanings.sent5: The concept of anabaptism is like giving your faith a second chance to grow stronger.

meanings.definition: A member of a Protestant sect that practices adult baptism.
meanings.sent1: She became an anabaptism after joining the Protestant sect.
meanings.sent2: An anabaptism is someone who practices adult baptism within their faith community.
meanings.sent3: The anabaptism brought a sense of tradition and change to the church.
meanings.sent4: Being an anabaptism was like being part of a unique and close-knit group.
meanings.sent5: The anabaptism's dedication to adult baptism was truly inspiring to others in the congregation.
